item.title: [Q] Regarding NPC

@xEnt wrote:

what dear god said, but also remember to add npc.unblock() under the first owner.setBusy(false) also swap the break; with return;

item.title: [Q] Regarding NPC
item.dc:creator: @dear_god1 dear god
item.description:
@dear_god1 wrote:

You forgot to add owner.setBusy(false); in the ‘else’

It should look like this:

							else {
												owner.getInventory().remove(1344, 1);
												owner.getInventory().add(new InvItem(593, 1));
												owner.getActionSender().sendInventory();
												npc.unblock();
                                                                                                owner.setBusy(false);
											}}

Read full topic

item.title: [Q] Regarding NPC
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Hello there

When I am wanting to check that the player has a specific stat, is this the correct way to go about checking if the player is above “50 Strength”.

if(owner.getCurStat(2) < 50){

Secondly, I have created an NPC to trade an item for another item. Everything works fine, except for one thing. After the items have been traded over, the player just freezes. Everything else within the client is working, however the player is unable to move, execute any commands, etc. Do you know how I can fix this? -_-;

Here is what I have.

case 0: //Long world.getDelayedEventHandler().add(new ShortEvent(owner) { public void action() { if(owner.getInventory().countId(1344) < 1) { owner.getActionSender().sendMessage("You have run out of bars"); running = false; owner.setBusy(false); } else { owner.getInventory().remove(1344, 1); owner.getInventory().add(new InvItem(593, 1)); owner.getActionSender().sendInventory(); npc.unblock(); }} }); break;

Any help is greatly appreciated, as always

Regards,

Yong-Min

Read full topic
